reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Enhancing vocational education for youth in Myanmar border areas

description.narrative: For decades Myanmar, and especially its border areas, have been isolated from international and regional development. After changes in political environment and opening after international isolation, Myanmar has the potential for economic growth given its rich natural resources, young workforce and access to markets of significant neighbouring economies. One of the biggest challenges for Myanmar economy is lack of skilled labour. At the same time, according to Census data (2014) Myanmar has high youth popul ation that is potential workforce in coming years, but only about 0.04 percent of the population had access to Technical and Vocational Education and Training. On the other hand, the government technical schools have limited capacity to provide qualified e ducation that would meet demands of the job market. The project seeks to contribute to peace building un Myanmar border areas through increasing access to quality vocational education and consequently increase opportunities and self-reliance for youth and other vulnerable IDP's returnees' and hosting community members. The specific objective is that the targeted youth and other vulnerable groups are equipped with technical and life skills to enhance their potentials for livelihood and life management. The p roject will have a particular focus on vulnerable youth including IDPs, returnees, early-school-leavers, ethnic minorities, female youth and youth with disabilities. Supporting measures will be taken to ensure inclusiveness of the trainings offered. The pr oject is implemented in cooperation with Government Technical High School in Loikaw, Kayah state. In cooperation with the School vocational education short courses will be organised. At the same time project focuses in development of vocational education i n the region in three priority areas: accessibility, quality of trainings and improved connection of vocational education providers to private sector. FRC coordinates its program with other actors working for the development of the vocational education sec tor in the country.
